I think the joke is trying to combing banking terminology with track and field terminology, since we see that crossover in the word "vault".

explanation: This is a play on words. The word "agreed" means to express agreement but "greed" is an intense selfish desire, like the desire to eat until one bursts.

text: Nature never did betray the heart that loved her .
A girl a day keeps the wife away .
He would promise to play golf, but he didn ' t know how to follow through .
s_p: carry a stroke to natural completion after hitting or releasing a ball
s_a: pursue to a conclusion or bring to a successful issue
explanation: The joke is a pun.  'Follow through' can typically be used to mean 'finish' or 'complete' some plan, so if one promises to play a game and never arranged it, they did not follow through.  However, in golf 'following through' means swinging the club fully instead of stopping at the point of contact with the ball.

text: Gotta run . . . the cat ' s caught in the printer again !
All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy .
It ' s a good horse that never stumbles .
Waiting for her photos to be developed a young girl sang ' Some day my prints will come . '
s_p: a printed picture produced from a photographic negative
s_a: a male member of a royal family other than the sovereign (especially the son of a sovereign)
explanation: Prints sounds like "prince". "Someday my prince will come" are the title and lyrics to a song sung in the movie Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs. In photography negatives are used to produce positive prints on paper, which is the photo. The whole joke circles around print.

text: Idle hands are the devil ' s playthings .
The artist was great . He could always draw a crowd .
s_p: make a mark or lines on a surface; engage in drawing; represent by making a drawing of, as with a pencil, chalk, etc. on a surface
s_a: direct toward itself or oneself by means of some psychological power or physical attributes
explanation: This is a pun on the phrase "draw a crowd" meaning to attract a crowd, but it's also being used here in the literal sense since artists are known to draw

text: By yourself you ' re in the right . In a group you ' re in the throng .
s_p: a large gathering of people
s_a: that which is contrary to the principles of justice or law
explanation: "Throng" sounds like "wrong". A throng is a pack of people. "In a group you're in the throng" which is correct, but also sounds like "in the group you're in the wrong" which is the opposite of "by yourself you're in the right".

text: A guy became so good with a chainsaw that he was promoted to branch manager .
s_p: a division of a stem, or secondary stem arising from the main stem of a plant
s_a: a division of some larger or more complex organization
explanation: The joke is a play on words.  'Branch manager' is a management position of employment.  'Branch manager' could also be twisted to mean a manager of tree branches, as chainsaws are typically used to saw trees.

text: If intervening was an olympic sport, he ' d win the gold meddle .
s_p: intrude in other people's affairs or business; interfere unwantedly
s_a: an award for winning a championship or commemorating some other event
explanation: To 'meddle' is to mess around, or intervene, in someone else's business when it's not welcome. Here it's also a homonym for 'medal' - what Olympians compete for at the Olympic games.

text: If at first you don ' t succeed, try, try again .
Roentgen was radiating .
s_p: send out rays or waves
s_a: experience a feeling of well-being or happiness, as from good health or an intense emotion
explanation: This is a play on words. A "roentgen" is a unit of ionizing radiation. The word "radiating" means emitting energy but "radiating" also means containing radiation, since "roentgens" are used to measure radiation.

text: ' ' Boy, that ' s a bright star, ' ' said Tom seriously .
s_p: in a serious manner
s_a: the brightest star in the sky; in Canis Major
explanation: This is a play on words. The word "seriously" means with earnest intent but "sirius" is the brightest star in the night sky.

text: Talk is cheap - - supply exceeds demand !
When you ' re wearing a watch on an airplane, time flies .
s_p: travel in an airplane; travel through the air; be airborne
s_a: pass away rapidly
explanation: This is a joke based on the idea that when you're flying, time can seemingly move quicker and if you're wearing a watch, the time (on your wrist) is technically flying

text: Working hard to become roadkill on the Infobahn .
It is an ill bird that fouls its own nest .
A cat that swallowed a ball of wool had mittens .
s_p: glove that encases the thumb separately and the other four fingers together
s_a: young domestic cat
explanation: This is a pun on 'mittens' which are gloves with two sections, one for the thumb and the other for all four fingers and are usually made of wool. It's being used because cats give birth to kittens which sounds similar to 'mittens'

text: She was only a Butcher ' s daughter, but there wasn ' t much more she could loin .
s_p: a cut of meat taken from the side and back of an animal between the ribs and the rump
s_a: get to know or become aware of, usually accidentally
explanation: This is a pun that relies upon a New York Accent.

text: The grass is always greener on the other side .
Don ' t argue with a bomb inventor - he might blow up at you .
s_p: burst and release energy as through a violent chemical or physical reaction
s_a: get very angry and fly into a rage
explanation: A bomb is an explosive device designed to explode when detonated. Blow up is another term for explode. Blow up also means to get extremely and openly angry. The joke is centered around the term "blow up" and using it to describe how a bomb inventor may act.

text: Actions are usually right, but the reasons seldom are .
Pavlov was drooling at the thought .
s_p: be envious, desirous, eager for, or extremely happy about something
s_a: let saliva drivel from the mouth
explanation: This joke would be funnier if we knew what thought Pavlov was drooling about. It's a play on the drooling dogs that Pavlov, a behavioral scientist, was famous for conditioning to associate a ringing bell with incoming food.

text: In a bakery buns usually play a small role .
s_p: normal or customary activity of a person in a particular social setting; what something is used for
s_a: small rounded bread either plain or sweet
explanation: A role is a part. Role sounds like roll. A roll is a piece of bread that is small. The buns, which are a type of bread, play a small role, as in, buns are small rolls.

text: If you can ' t beat them, join them .
Like cures like .
What was the best thing BEFORE sliced bread ?
If two wrongs don ' t make a right, try three .
Meaning of life : < deleted for lack of space >
A . 45 beats a royal flush EVERY TIME
I haven ' t developed my photographs yet, said Tom negatively .
s_p: in a negative way
s_a: a piece of photographic film showing an image with light and shade or colors reversed
explanation: The joke is a pun.  Undeveloped photos are called 'negatives'.  To say something 'negatively' means to say something in a pessimistic way.

text: It takes a village to raise a child .
Rental agents offer quarters for dollars .
s_p: housing available for people to live in
s_a: a United States or Canadian coin worth one fourth of a dollar
explanation: Quarters are coins that are worth twenty-five cents. Four quarters are worth the same as one dollar. Quarters can also mean a living space. Rental agents offer living spaces, or quarters to people. The joke is playing on the word quarters and how it relates to money and to a living space.

text: Never look a gift horse in the mouth .
